<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 209]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 304, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 5 Mechanics 2 (M2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 495, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 720, 510]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 590, 526]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 527, 606, 543]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 557, 606, 573]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 573, 756, 589]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 590, 440, 605]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 606, 907, 636]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A small ball is projected with speed \(20 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) at an angle of \(45^{\circ}\) above the horizontal from a point \(O\) on horizontal ground. At time \(t\) s after projection, the horizontal and vertically upwards displacements of the ball from \(O\) are \(x \mathrm{~m}\) and \(y \mathrm{~m}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 135, 153, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 395, 153]]<|/det|>
Express \(x\) and \(y\) in terms of \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 918, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 166, 153, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 166, 685, 185]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation of the trajectory of the ball is \(y = x - \frac{1}{40} x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 198, 153, 216]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 198, 784, 216]]<|/det|>
State the distance from \(O\) of the point at which the ball first strikes the ground.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 200, 920, 217]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 246, 96, 265]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 244, 920, 295]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.4 \mathrm{~kg}\) is attached to one end of a light elastic string of natural length \(1.2 \mathrm{~m}\) and modulus of elasticity \(19.2 \mathrm{~N}\). The other end of the string is attached to a fixed point \(A\). The particle \(P\) is released from rest at the point \(2.7 \mathrm{~m}\) vertically above \(A\). Calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 301, 153, 319]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 301, 384, 319]]<|/det|>
the initial acceleration of \(P\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 303, 920, 320]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 327, 153, 345]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 327, 428, 345]]<|/det|>
the speed of \(P\) when it reaches \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 327, 920, 345]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 373, 96, 392]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[334, 381, 702, 504]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 527, 920, 592]]<|/det|>
A uniform object \(ABC\) is formed from two rods \(AB\) and \(BC\) joined rigidly at right angles at \(B\). The rod \(AB\) has length \(0.3 \mathrm{~m}\) and the rod \(BC\) has length \(0.2 \mathrm{~m}\). The object rests with the end \(A\) on a rough horizontal surface and the rod \(AB\) vertical. The object is held in equilibrium by a horizontal force of magnitude \(4 \mathrm{~N}\) applied at \(B\) and acting in the direction \(CB\) (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 605, 153, 623]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 605, 650, 623]]<|/det|>
Find the distance of the centre of mass of the object from \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 606, 920, 623]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 636, 153, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 636, 435, 655]]<|/det|>
Calculate the weight of the object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 637, 920, 655]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 667, 153, 685]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 667, 895, 685]]<|/det|>
Find the least possible value of the coefficient of friction between the surface and the object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 700]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 730, 94, 747]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 728, 920, 777]]<|/det|>
A particle of mass \(0.2 \mathrm{~kg}\) is projected vertically downwards with initial speed \(4 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\). A resisting force of magnitude \(0.09 \nu \mathrm{~N}\) acts vertically upwards on the particle during its descent, where \(\nu \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) is the downwards velocity of the particle at time \(t\) s after being set in motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 792, 153, 810]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 792, 658, 810]]<|/det|>
Show that the acceleration of the particle is \((10 - 0.45\nu) \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 792, 920, 810]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 823, 153, 841]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 823, 324, 841]]<|/det|>
Find \(\nu\) when \(t = 1.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 823, 920, 841]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) is projected with speed \(50 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) at an angle of \(40^{\circ}\) above the horizontal from a point \(O\). For the instant \(2.5 \mathrm{~s}\) after projection, calculate

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 114, 146, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 114, 280, 133]]<|/det|>
the speed of \(P\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 139, 153, 158]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 139, 492, 158]]<|/det|>
the angle between \(OP\) and the horizontal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 139, 920, 158]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 186, 94, 204]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 196, 732, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 304, 920, 370]]<|/det|>
One end of a light inextensible string of length \(0.2 \mathrm{~m}\) is attached to a fixed point \(A\) which is above a smooth horizontal table. A particle \(P\) of mass \(0.3 \mathrm{~kg}\) is attached to the other end of the string. \(P\) moves on the table in a horizontal circle, with the string taut and making an angle of \(60^{\circ}\) with the downward vertical (see diagram).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 382, 153, 401]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 382, 662, 401]]<|/det|>
Calculate the tension in the string if the speed of \(P\) is \(1.2 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 383, 920, 401]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 414, 153, 432]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 414, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
For the motion as described, show that the angular speed of \(P\) cannot exceed \(10 \mathrm{rad} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\), and hence find the greatest possible value for the kinetic energy of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 476, 94, 495]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[304, 485, 727, 667]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 683, 920, 720]]<|/det|>
\(OABC\) is the cross-section through the centre of mass of a uniform prism of weight \(20 \mathrm{~N}\). The cross-section is in the shape of a sector of a circle with centre \(O\), radius \(OA = r \mathrm{~m}\) and angle \(AOC = \frac{2}{3}\pi\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 718, 920, 785]]<|/det|>
The prism lies on a plane inclined at an angle \(\theta\) radians to the horizontal, where \(\theta < \frac{1}{3}\pi\). \(OC\) lies along a line of greatest slope with \(O\) higher than \(C\). The prism is freely hinged to the plane at \(O\). A force of magnitude \(15 \mathrm{~N}\) acts at \(A\), in a direction towards to the plane and at right angles to it (see diagram). Given that the prism remains in equilibrium, find the set of possible values of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 766, 920, 785]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
